segment.source: Act as part of the operating system (Windows 10)
segment.target: Act as part of the operating system (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Act as part of the operating system security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Act as part of the operating system security policy setting.

segment.source: Act as part of the operating system
segment.target: Act as part of the operating system

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Act as part of the operating system security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Act as part of the operating system security policy setting.

segment.source: The Act as part of the operating system policy setting determines whether a process can assume the identity of any user and thereby gain access to the resources that the user is authorized to access.
segment.target: The Act as part of the operating system policy setting determines whether a process can assume the identity of any user and thereby gain access to the resources that the user is authorized to access.

segment.source: Typically, only low-level authentication services require this user right.
segment.target: Typically, only low-level authentication services require this user right.

segment.source: Potential access is not limited to what is associated with the user by default.
segment.target: Potential access is not limited to what is associated with the user by default.

segment.source: The calling process may request that arbitrary additional privileges be added to the access token.
segment.target: The calling process may request that arbitrary additional privileges be added to the access token.

segment.source: The calling process may also build an access token that does not provide a primary identity for auditing in the system event logs.
segment.target: The calling process may also build an access token that does not provide a primary identity for auditing in the system event logs.

segment.source: Do not assign this right to any user accounts.
segment.target: Do not assign this right to any user accounts.

segment.source: Only assign this user right to trusted users.
segment.target: Only assign this user right to trusted users.

segment.source: If a service requires this user right, configure the service to log on by using the local System account, which inherently includes this user right.
segment.target: If a service requires this user right, configure the service to log on by using the local System account, which inherently includes this user right.

segment.source: Do not create a separate account and assign this user right to it.
segment.target: Do not create a separate account and assign this user right to it.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: The Act as part of the operating system user right is extremely powerful.
segment.target: The Act as part of the operating system user right is extremely powerful.

segment.source: Users with this user right can take complete control of the device and erase evidence of their activities.
segment.target: Users with this user right can take complete control of the device and erase evidence of their activities.

segment.source: Restrict the Act as part of the operating system user right to as few accounts as possible—it should not even be assigned to the Administrators group under typical circumstances.
segment.target: Restrict the Act as part of the operating system user right to as few accounts as possible—it should not even be assigned to the Administrators group under typical circumstances.

segment.source: When a service requires this user right, configure the service to log on with the Local System account, which inherently includes this privilege.
segment.target: When a service requires this user right, configure the service to log on with the Local System account, which inherently includes this privilege.

segment.source: Do not create a separate account and assign this user right to it.
segment.target: Do not create a separate account and assign this user right to it.

segment.source: There should be little or no impact because the Act as part of the operating system user right is rarely needed by any accounts other than the Local System account.
segment.target: There should be little or no impact because the Act as part of the operating system user right is rarely needed by any accounts other than the Local System account.
